page.title: 01THE ROAD TO LESWALT
page.content: Our block rises in undulating grassy slopes from the sea shore of Loch Ryan, westward to the village of Lestwalt (pop 200) hence south-westwards up through the wooded Glen of Aldouran towards the grounds of Lochnaw Castle, the home of the Agnews. Again, from the shore, south to southwest across a fine 18 hole golf course, over the rich dairy, beef and sheep farmlands reaching its furzy and marshy height of 120m above Allandoo and Glenstockadale. Sparsely populated by 14 farms and few occupied cottages outside the village, the area is served by one church (C.of S.), one primary school (pop 41), one shop cum P.O., a car sales and service station and 5 buses daily to Stranraer (pop 10,000), 3km east, with its rail and ferry terminal, shopping and
